t: “Ho!*pn Everyone who thirsts, Come*ld to the waters; And*ld you who have no money, Come,*ld buy and eat. Yes,*ld come, buy wine and milk Without*ld money and without price.

Why*ld do you spend money for what*i is*i not bread, And*ld your wages for what*i does not satisfy? Listen*ld carefully to Me, and eat what*i is*i good, And*ld let your soul delight itself in abundance.
Incline*ld your ear, and come to Me. Hear,*ld and your soul shall live; And*ld I will make an everlasting covenant with you— The*ld sure mercies of David.
Indeed*ld I have given him as*i a witness to the people, A*ld leader and commander for the people.

Surely*ld you shall call a nation you do not know, And*ld nations who*i do not know you shall run to you, Because*ld of the Lord*s your God, And*ld the Holy One of Israel; For*ld He has glorified you.”
Seek*ln the Lord*s while He may be found, Call*ld upon Him while He is near.
Let*ld the wicked forsake his way, And*ld the unrighteous man his thoughts; Let*ld him return to the Lord,*s And*ld He will have mercy on him; And*ld to our God, For*ld He will abundantly pardon.
“For*ln My thoughts are*i not your thoughts, Nor*ld are*i your ways My ways,” says the Lord.*s
“For*ld as*i the heavens are higher than the earth, So*ld are My ways higher than your ways, And*ld My thoughts than your thoughts.

“For*ln as the rain comes down, and the snow from heaven, And*ld do not return there, But*ld water the earth, And*ld make it bring forth and bud, That*ld it may give seed to the sower And*ld bread to the eater,
So*ld shall My word be that goes forth from My mouth; It*ld shall not return to Me void, But*ld it shall accomplish what I please, And*ld it shall prosper in*i the*i thing*i for which I sent it.

“For*ln you shall go out with joy, And*ld be led out with peace; The*ld mountains and the hills Shall*ld break forth into singing before you, And*ld all the trees of the field shall clap their*i hands.

Instead*ld of the thorn shall come up the cypress tree, And*ld instead of the brier shall come up the myrtle tree; And*ld it shall be to the Lord*s for a name, For*ld an everlasting sign that*i shall not be cut off.”
